text: Qispi Q'awa (Aymara, qispi something glittering, q'awa little river, ditch, crevice, fissure, gap in the earth, "glittering brook" or "glittering ravine", Hispanicized spelling Quispiccahua) is a mountain in the Andes of Peru, about high. It is situated in the Huancavelica Region, Huaytará Province, Pilpichaca District. Qispi Q'awa lies west of Wakan Q'allay.escale.minedu.gob.pe - UGEL map of the Huamanga Province (Ayacucho Region) ==References== Category:Mountains of Peru Category:Mountains of Huancavelica Region
title: Qispi Q'awa
